did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Women's shelter and community service organization. Safe Passage (formerly Necessities/Necesidades) was founded in Northampton, Massachusetts in 1978 as a women's collective to provide shelter and assistance to battered women and their children and to empower women with self-help techniques for ending abusive relationships. In addition the organization educates the community about violence against women through public programs. Records include internal documents such as executive director's files; financial records; and correspondence, 1978-1992. Public records include material documenting the history of the organization; publicity and fundraising material; material related to other women's organizations; and pamphlets, articles and other printed material that relate to the subject of battered women. [NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]

bioghist.p: Safe Passage (formerly Necessities/Necesidades) was founded in Northampton, Massachusetts in 1978 as a women's collective intended "to empower women by providing them with self-help techniques that allow them to end abusive relationships." In addition to this work, the organization also educates the community about violence against women through public programs and publications and by training volunteers. Perhaps most important, it provides shelter and assistance to battered women and their children. In 1995 the organization abandoned its collective framework in favor of a more hierarchical organizing structure that included two co-directors and an expanded board. In 1998 they adopted a single director model. In 2000, Necessities/Necesidades changed its name to Safe Passage.

scopecontent.p: The Safe Passage (formerly Necessities/Necesidades) records include both internal and public material. Internal records consist of: executive director's files; financial records; correspondence, and personal records, 1978-1992. Public records include material that documents the history of the organization; publicity and fundraising material; material related to other women's organizations, including Necessities predecessors HLRIPP and HERA; and pamphlets, articles and other printed material that relate to the subject of battered women.
[NOTE: The contents list for this collection is not online. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection if you would like one sent to you.]
